channel.title: GNOME Power Manager
channel.description:
Well, I'm running Ubuntu 8.10 on my laptop. I was using Pidgin to talk to my friend via MSN, when I was called to help with the Christmas decorations. When I came back my screen was black (not turned off, more like a black screen saver, since I was out for about 20 mins), my keyboard did not work, my mouse did not work, i pressed every key on the keyboard and every mouse button, and nothing took off the black screen. I was forced to press the power button on the laptop, now every time I turn on my laptop and select Ubuntu as the OS, after I login the screen is black, and a small box comes out at the bottom right corner saying :
The configuration defaults for GNOME Power Manager have not been installed correctly. Please contact your computer administrator.
Any ideas on how to fix this? For what it counts, i installed the OS by adding a new partition with the Paragon partition manager, then i extracted the .iso i downloaded from http://ubuntu.com/ , and ran "wubi.exe"

item.title: GNOME Power Manager
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Sounds like your screen is ‘locked’, you should be able to move your mouse or touch a key and type in your password to unlock it.

nueb35:

my keyboard did not work, my mouse did not work, i pressed every key on the keyboard and every mouse button, and nothing took off the black screen.

mitb: you are either blind, or fucking stupid

Read full topic

item.title: GNOME Power Manager
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:7, topic:245294”]Sounds like your screen is ‘locked’, you should be able to move your mouse or touch a key and type in your password to unlock it.

If that doesn’t work, boot to the ‘recovery mode’ which will give you a root terminal, from which you can fix anything.

Try Arch Linux.

He can’t even install Ubuntu without running a .exe from inside windows but you suggest he install Arch Linux? Bad suggestion.[/quote]

Haha nice one mopar, I dont like Arch Linux though, I like debians package system the best. Im not using linux though because I need photoshop and dreamweaver and itunes. GIMP just dosent cut it for me.

Read full topic

item.title: GNOME Power Manager
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Sounds like your screen is ‘locked’, you should be able to move your mouse or touch a key and type in your password to unlock it.

If that doesn’t work, boot to the ‘recovery mode’ which will give you a root terminal, from which you can fix anything.

R.I.P RSC:

Try Arch Linux.

He can’t even install Ubuntu without running a .exe from inside windows but you suggest he install Arch Linux? Bad suggestion.

Read full topic

well after long googling, i have decided to remove ubuntu and stay on vista

@nueb35 wrote:

not from inside, unless the login screen has an option for it. or unless safemode has one, (safemode works)
